description.narrative: (Ghana): Women account for 70 percent of total food production and marketing in Ghana, yet face persistent economic constraints, including limited access, ownership, and decision-making power related to land and key productive resources to succeed as agricultural entrepreneurs. They also have limited participation and representation in agriculture and natural resources groups. About 40.4 percent of women in agriculture also do not have access to credit and financial services, while only 9.5 percent have access to extension services. Considering the substantial role women play in Ghana's agriculture and other aspects of the Ghanaian economy, it is important to empower them to succeed as entrepreneurs, especially in the agricultural sector and in other key decision-making platforms towards achieving inclusive growth in the agricultural sector. .Using fiscal year 2019 funds, USAID will work to strengthen women's capacity to succeed as entrepreneurs, especially in the agricultural sector, strengthen the capacity of local government authorities to lead participatory and responsive agricultural governance and support early warning mechanisms to manage conflicts and mitigate violence to help realize year-round agricultural productivity. Building upon past work, USAID will support local and regional authorities and civil society organizations including women's groups in Northern Ghana by building their capacity in the areas of institutional development, leadership, and change management. USAID will also conduct several advocacy campaigns to ensure better opportunities for women's participation in the agricultural sector at the local, regional, and national levels. .. .

participating-org.narrative: Cooperative for Assistance and Relief Everywhere
